A string is a sequence of characters, for example "Hello, World!" is a string.<br />
Here is a list of every default string manipulation function present in Lua.

* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.byte string.byte]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.char string.char]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.dump string.dump]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.find string.find]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.format string.format]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.gmatch string.gmatch]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.gsub string.gsub]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.len string.len]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.lower string.lower]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.match string.match]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.rep string.rep]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.reverse string.reverse]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.sub string.sub]
* [http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/manual.html#pdf-string.upper string.upper]
